That's great to hear! Running into an old friend on the bus can definitely brighten up your day. It's amazing how a chance encounter can bring back fond memories and create new connections.

Now, about that pour-over: you're absolutely right that it's a great way to bring out the flavors of the coffee beans. The pour-over method allows for a high degree of control over the brewing process, which means you can tailor the flavor to your liking.

Here are some tips to help you get started with pour-over:

1. **Invest in a good pour-over dripper**: There are many types of pour-over drippers available, but look for one made from glass, ceramic, or stainless steel. Avoid plastic or paper filters, as they can absorb some of the coffee's natural oils.
2. **Choose a high-quality coffee bean**: Fresh, high-quality beans will result in a more flavorful cup. Look for beans that have been roasted recently and have a good reputation for flavor.
3. **Use the right water temperature**: The ideal water temperature for brewing coffee is between 195°F and 205°F. If the water is too hot, it can burn the coffee, while water that's too cold can result in a weak brew.
4. **Use the right amount of coffee**: A general rule of thumb is to use 1 tablespoon of coffee for every 6 ounces of water. You can adjust this ratio to suit your taste preferences.
5. **Pour in a circular motion**: When pouring the water over the coffee grounds, try to pour in a circular motion to evenly saturate all of the grounds.
6. **Be patient**: Pour-over brewing can take a few minutes, so be patient and enjoy the process.

Remember, practice makes perfect, so don't be discouraged if your first few pour-overs don't turn out exactly as you hoped. Keep experimenting with different roasts, grind sizes, and brewing techniques until you find the perfect cup.

Good luck, and I hope you enjoy your pour-over adventure!
